intro: Rodriguezia pardina, commonly known as the red-twigged hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its striking red or purple stems, which are often more prominent than its relatively small, showy flowers. Its leaves are typically alternate, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Rodriguezia pardina thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks.
